page.title: 05WAULDBY FARM.
page.content: The farmer has some Massey Ferguson tractors, a Sanderson Bulldozer and a Combine Harvester. He has a drill for sowing seeds. He employs three men and two students a year. The students then go back to Bishop Burton Agricultural College. In the summer he allows more students to come for training. Two of the men look after the pigs, while the other one drives the machines. The farmer grows wheat, barley, peas and oil seed rape. The peas go to Bird's Eye for freezing. The farm is three hundred acres of chalky soil and mainly arable.
